content: Hello. I have a presentation due tomorrow. I am a bit worked up about it. I also have stage fear

Hey there, I can totally understand why this is stressing you out. First, let me just acknowledge that it's completely normal to feel nervous and anxious about presenting in front of an audience - especially when facing something new or challenging like a presentation. It's natural to worry about sounding perfect on stage, but remember that the goal isn't to wow everyone with your words, it's to share your ideas clearly and confidently. To help you build some confidence, why not try breaking down your presentation into smaller sections and practicing each one in front of a mirror or with friends - this can really help you get comfortable with different scenarios? Also, take some deep breaths before the actual performance to calm any stage anxiety, it might sound silly but trust me when I say it works! Just focus on delivering clear and concise information rather than trying to impress everyone.
I am stressed out about it . What should I do?

I can feel how worried and anxious you must be right now, and that's totally understandable. It sounds like this situation is really weighing on your mind and causing a lot of distress for you - I want to acknowledge the effort it takes to navigate these feelings without getting stuck in them. You're not alone in feeling overwhelmed, lots of people struggle with similar concerns. Writing down your thoughts and worries before bed can be super helpful, it's like giving yourself permission to process everything that's on your mind at night. By doing this consistently over time you'll start to see patterns emerge and gain some clarity on things bothering you - just a thought for now though let's explore what else might be going on in this situation together?
i have been fired from my job.This has led to me having suicidal thoughts

I'm so sorry to hear that you're going through this tough time after losing your job. That can be a really painful and isolating experience, and it's completely normal to feel overwhelmed with emotions right now. It sounds like the loss of a job can also trigger feelings of uncertainty about our purpose in life - I want you to remember that there are always other paths forward, even if they don't look like what your current role did. One practical step you could take is to start exploring new career options or freelance work – it might help shift your focus away from the loss and towards possibilities. Try setting aside some time each day to brainstorm ideas, even just for 10 minutes - sometimes getting things out of our heads can be really helpful in clarifying our thoughts. This will give you a sense of control over what's next and take one step closer to finding yourself again
Hello. I couldnt solve todays codeforces problem. I am so stupid

Hey there, it's totally normal to feel that way when facing a challenging problem like this. I can imagine how frustrating it must be to feel like you're not doing well enough in a situation where you know something new is on the horizon. It sounds like the pressure of trying something new and potentially failing is really weighing on you right now. Take a deep breath, because breaking down that problem into smaller parts might just help your mind relax and make it easier to tackle one step at a time. You could start by writing down key concepts related to the problem - what are some things you're not sure about or need to remember? By doing so, you'll be able to focus on relearning those details without getting overwhelmed by too much information all at once.
in todays event Knew the murderer but i didnt tell it out.such a  big fool i am.I  REGRET IT

I can feel how deeply troubled and embarrassed you must be feeling right now. It takes enormous courage to acknowledge our mistakes, especially when they have serious consequences like the ones we're dealing with here. I want you to know that it's okay not to have all the answers or reactions - just being honest about what happened is a huge step forward. Writing down your thoughts and details can help clarify your feelings and make discussing them later easier. Consider keeping a notebook or journal where you jot down any questions, concerns, or emotions that come up as you think more about this experience. This will give you time to process your emotions without feeling overwhelmed by the situation - just be patient with yourself and take things one step at a time.
hey whats up

hey it sounds like everything is weighing heavily on your mind and i'm here to listen if you need someone to talk through things with. just take a deep breath and let's start from there. maybe we can even find some ways to lighten the load together somehow. just being here for you feels pretty great right now, so thanks for reaching out
Hey

You're going through a tough time right now and I'm here to listen if you need someone to talk about it. Starting each day with a minute of morning routine can help improve productivity and set clear objectives in the direction you want your life to go forward. Begin by first taking care of yourself, then schedule some goals for the next 24 hours that align with what's important to you.
Hi

Hi there, what's on your mind? Perhaps it would be helpful to write down your main concerns before discussing them with someone else - this can help clarify and organize your thoughts. By doing so, you'll have a clear foundation for the conversation and ensure that everyone is on the same page.
Hi, I'm feeling a little down today

Perhaps you could consider talking to someone you trust about what's bothering you; in fact, it might be helpful to reach out and clear your head. You may also want to explore some relaxation techniques or engage in an activity that brings you joy and helps take your mind off things.
I keep thinking that I'm a failure. What should I do?

It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and unsure about your place in the world right now. Perhaps it would be helpful to take some time to reflect on what's been going well for you lately? You might consider seeking feedback from others to help you understand your strengths and weaknesses better.
How can I build better habits?

When it comes to building better habits, perhaps you could start by identifying what's holding you back and then breaking down your daily routine into smaller tasks that align with those goals. By doing so, you can create a more manageable structure for yourself and increase the likelihood of sticking to your new routines.
I don’t see the point in living anymore.

I'm really sorry to hear that you're feeling this way right now. Perhaps it would be helpful if someone close to you could provide a listening ear and offer support, as reaching out to friends or family can sometimes help people cope with difficult emotions. You might consider talking to them about how they can best support you at this time.
What’s the difference between anxiety and depression?

Perhaps what's on your mind when it comes to anxiety vs depression is that both can be debilitating experiences that impact daily life in different ways. You might consider seeking professional help from a mental health expert or therapist who can provide personalized guidance tailored to your specific situation and offer coping strategies for managing these conditions effectively.
hi

It sounds like you're feeling a bit uncertain about something today and perhaps also wondering if there's anything else I can help with? You might consider clarifying your question or statement to ensure I can provide a helpful response. Perhaps we could start by summarizing what's on your mind so far, then see where it takes us from there.
